bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, February 18, 1880

div1.p: Reed has clothing sent to McPherson. McPherson testifies in U.S. vs. McGowan. Reed writes concerning medical matters.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, February 18, 1880
div1.p:
Your letter came
by to-day's mail, & I, at once, hur-
-ried Adrian over & had your valise
packed- I put in the following
articles: Blue Coat, vest & pants- diag-
-onal coat & vest - two shirts - one
night-shirt - 1 pair of drawers- 4 or
5 collars - several pairs of socks - and
a black-tie- I believe that is all-
I had Adrian take the package over
to the store, at once, as Mr Staples
told me that the carrier would
leave in the morning- I have since
learned, this evening, that he will
not go till day after to-morrow,
which will give me a chance to
see him myself to-morrow & see
that he takes it- I will ascertain
about your Ration to-morrow and
let you know later on in my letter-
I got your telegram about the
package from Lucas, & have de-
layed answering, hoping that it
would come at by to-day's mail,
but am sorry to say that it did
not- I am afraid that it has
been lost or misplaced somewhere
en route - was it registered? Hope
that you will yet get it- So you
go to Lowell to give evidence in
the Case of the U.S. against Captain
McGowan? “Hesche”, my boy! That
will be a pleasant journey for
you- Just take my advice & sit
right down on the Court, if it
so much as says “Jack Robinson”
to-you! I guess Capt. Mac, will
make it interesting for all hands-
Does Mills also go as a witness?
I have a good notion of going
myself- We heard that Tommy
Cruse was on his way to Apache,
or was coming here, or something
of the kind- What was the rumor
occasioned by? Is he coming?
I wish the whole outfit of you
could come back, to enliven Apache
stupidity- The only news I can give, is
that I have a “bile” on the dorsum
(not of my back-sides, Dorsey, oh!
no!) of my left hand, & have it now
well enveloped in a flux-seed poul-
tice- Ladd, the immortal clappist
is again in Hospital- This time with
inflammation & fear- He still has his
“Klapp”! It sticketh to him “closer
than a brother”! A good lesson for
erring youth- I have a recruit with
consumption, a case of some interest-
more of this, to-morrow- will now fall
too on “Draper's Intellectual Develop-
-ment of Europe”- Thursday Morning-
The Stewd Says he will attend to selling your
Ration to P.T., but says that is the ration for
January, & not December as you stated
in your letter- Is that alright? Love
to Mammy & Tommy -- write me soon.
